text: got an interesting challenge from a client today... they want a dynamic map on their site, but they want it to be isolated to only one county (parish). They want it emphasized that they specialize only in that particular county; anyone ever built anything like this? I think if I could even just highlight the particular county on a google map (using a css-filter or something) that might work, but figured I'd ask you guys in case anyone had gotten a request like this in the past.
you could use an SVG map of the area and highlight the county with an animation of some sort

I think what Stefen said is the route I’d go because it sounds like showing a full google map might add confusion that’s unnecessary, and since it’s a county, odds are you don’t need that level of detail anyways.

you can use a polygon overlay with Google maps:
<https://jsfiddle.net/jmao2o3o/3/>

<@U7ADCU3BM> that looks awesome, and is only two counties away :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:

Thanks guys, I didn't even think of SVG, This should work nicely. Thanks!
That's awesome! Thanks for sharing this.

Thanks for the share! We just had a similar challenge, but it was for 3 different counties in the NYC area. We decided on doing a shaded static map, since the level of detail required was minimal. We didn’t even consider an SVG :woman-facepalming:
Hey you can just put that together with D3.js if you need to work with real lat long points
And <@UCC8LGD43> here is a JSON map with counties that you can whittle down

just thought I’d post this as this is a really awesome resource - <https://www.pexels.com/>

Actually good royalty free stock photos.

It’s what I used for photos in my slides at Inbound: <https://spin.d.pr/cRylWW+>
I’ve personally tried a ton of royalty free photo sites and frankly this one impresses me because the photos are actually good.

damn, sick list dude. I'd post my own, but I'm pretty sure they're all in there lmao

another one to add to the list: <https://www.freeimages.com/>

It used to be amazing back when it was called <http://sxc.hu|sxc.hu> istock bought them out and  made <http://freeimages.com|freeimages.com> it’s like a teaser to get you to go to istock now.
That <http://stocks.im|stocks.im> one is going to be a MAJOR timesuck for us lol
